meanings.definition: Resembling a mosaic in appearance or composition.
meanings.sent1: The colorful rug had a mosaiclike pattern that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a mosaiclike mural using small tiles of different colors.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome had a mosaiclike hat made of tiny glass pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was mosaiclike, with different traits coming together to form a unique whole.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in a mosaiclike array of colors, stunning everyone who saw it.

meanings.definition: Made up of diverse elements or fragments.
meanings.sent1: The collage was a mosaiclike collection of magazine clippings and photographs.
meanings.sent2: The committee was a mosaiclike group, each member bringing a different perspective.
meanings.sent3: The jigsaw puzzle was so challenging, it felt like a mosaiclike task to complete.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were mosaiclike, bits and pieces from different times in her life.
meanings.sent5: The forest floor was a mosaiclike carpet of fallen leaves, twigs, and flowers.
